solution_line_template: Omar drinks {on_way_to_work_fraction} * {total_cup_ounces} = {total_cup_ounces}/{on_way_to_work_fraction.denominator} = <<{total_cup_ounces}/{on_way_to_work_fraction.denominator}={drank_on_way_to_work}>>{drank_on_way_to_work} ounces on the way to work.

Omar drinks {at_office_fraction} * {total_cup_ounces} = {total_cup_ounces}/{at_office_fraction.denominator} = <<{total_cup_ounces}/{at_office_fraction.denominator}={drank_at_office}>>{drank_at_office} ounces when he gets to his office.

When he drinks {drank_cold_coffee} ounce more, he will have drunk {drank_on_way_to_work} + {drank_at_office} + {drank_cold_coffee} = <<{drank_on_way_to_work}+{drank_at_office}+{drank_cold_coffee}={total_drank}>>{total_drank} ounces.
Thus, there will be {total_cup_ounces} - {total_drank} = <<{total_cup_ounces}-{total_drank}={ounces_left}>>{ounces_left} ounces left in the cup afterward.
